text: I'm developing my first package, and I'm kind of lost on how one does the versioning... I mean, I just finished writing the core of the package, and deployed the documentation. How do I properly manage the versions? How do I say that what I have now is "version 1.0", and create a stable doc? I've read the documentation on Documenter.jl, but it is not clear to me still.

text: Correct, Project.toml is the one place you have to manually write the version, then you use Registrator

elements.text: Correct, Project.toml is the one place you have to manually write the version, then you use Registrator

text: And Documenter will deploy the documentation for the release once TagBot creates a tag corresponding to the version registered in General (assuming everything is set up correctly; one specific thing to double check is that CI runs on tags)
